Event.name: Getting_vehicle_underway
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Driver</fen> prepares a <fen>Vehicle</fen> for travel by placing it in the normal location for the operation of the vehicle or by detaching it from a place where it was held.
<ex>Throughout Irish history, <fex name="Driver">countless generations of exiles</fex> have <t>cast</t> <t>off</t> <fex name="Source">from the shores of Ireland</fex>.</ex> <ex>"Good," said Matt as <fex name="Driver">he</fex> <t>pulled</t> <fex name="Vehicle">the car</fex> <fex name="Source">out of the parking space</fex>.</ex> <ex>The next day, after <t>weighing</t> <t>anchor</t>, <fex name="Driver">we</fex> cleared Longboat Pass Bridge, and exited the ICW into the open waters of the Gulf of Mexico.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Driver
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This is the being, typically human, that prepares the <fen>Vehicle</fen> for motion, and will control it once it is in motion.
<ex><fex name="Driver">He</fex> shook his head in amazement and slowly <t>pulled</t> the car out of the parking lot.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The device--such as a car, boat, spaceship,. etc.--which is used for transport and is prepared for travel by the <fen>Driver</fen>.
<ex>Lyle was feeling very pleased with himself as he <t>pulled</t> <fex name="Veh">the BMW</fex> out of its parking space.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any expression which describes the location that the <fen>Vehicle</fen> has been stationed at.
<ex>The ship <t>cast</t> <t>off</t> <fex name="Source">from Pier 21</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Intended_goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location that the <fen>Vehicle</fen> is intended to travel to.
<ex> At 1500 65 Royal Air Force personnel came aboard and the LCI 35 <t>cast</t> <t>off</t> <fex name="int">for England</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Driver that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously</ment>, <ment>coldly</ment>, <ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>).
<ex>The Duchess of Northumberland <fex name="Manr">slowly</fex> <t>weighed</t> <t>anchor</t> and pulled away from the wharf at London.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Driver</fen> or <fen>Vehicle</fen> during the preparations.
<ex>We <t>cast</t> <t>off</t> from the dock <fex name="Dep">in fear</fex> and headed for Pequaming.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action performed by the <fen>Driver</fen> by which they prepare the <fen>Vehicle</fen> for travel.
<ex>I <t>weighed</t> <t>anchor</t> <fex name="mns">by hand</fex> - an easy affair with a boat that weighs less than a ton - and headed south with the Class of '93-'94.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Result</fen> of the <fen>Driver</fen>'s action.
<ex>Bill <t>pulled</t> his Maserati out <fex name="Result">right into a truck</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Co-participant
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An individual or vehicle that is also involved in the preparations.
<ex>On 8 April the Admiral <t>weighed</t> <t>anchor</t> <fex name="Co-participant">with three of his consorts</fex>, leaving the others to follow.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the preparation of the <fen>Vehicle</fen> takes place.
<ex>At sunrise I <t>weighed</t> <t>anchor</t> <fex name="cir">in a light breeze</fex> and set off for Spain.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the <fen>Driver</fen> prepares the <fen>Vehicle</fen> for motion.
<ex>At 0900 on 10 September 1945, DE 353 <t>weighed</t> <t>anchor</t> <fex name="Place">in Victoria Harbor</fex>, adjacent to Labuan Island, Borneo.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration_of_final_state
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The length of the time that the <fen>Vehicle</fen> remains in the state of readiness.
<ex>We <t>weighed</t> <t>anchor</t> <fex name="dur">for only 2 hours</fex> before the storm became too intense.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Driver</fen> prepares the <fen>Vehicle</fen> for motion.
<ex>We <t>weighed</t> <t>anchor</t> <fex name="Time">in the afternoon of October 9th</fex> and got out of the harbour under all plain sail.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE marks a proposition from which the main clause logically follows.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: launch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: set (a boat or ship) afloat, especially by sliding it into the water.

lexUnit.name: weigh anchor.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take up the anchor when ready to sail

lexUnit.name: cast off.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: set a boat or ship free from her moorings.

lexUnit.name: pull (out).v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to steer a vehicle out of a parking or holding space

lexUnit.name: lift (off).v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Leave from the ground for air travel
